quiz.title: Chemistry Grade 11: Unit 9 Quiz 4
quiz.subtitle: 9.4: Calculating pH of Strong Acids and Strong Bases
quiz.subject: Chemistry

questions.question: Which of the following is characteristic of a 'Strong Acid'?
options: It dissociates completely into ions in aqueous solution
It has a high pH value
It only reacts with weak bases
It has a very small Ka value
questions.explanation: Strong acids like $HCl$ or $HNO_3$ exist almost entirely as ions in water, meaning the initial concentration of the acid equals the concentration of $H_3O^+$.

questions.question: What is the pH of a $0.01$ M solution of $HCl$?
questions.explanation: Since $HCl$ is a strong acid, $[H_3O^+] = 0.01$ M. $\text{pH} = -\log(0.01) = 2$.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the common strong acids?
questions.explanation: Acetic acid is a weak acid; it only partially dissociates in water. The others listed are the 'Big Six' strong acids.

questions.question: If a solution of $NaOH$ has a concentration of $0.001$ M, what is its pOH?
questions.explanation: $NaOH$ is a strong base, so $[OH^-] = 0.001$ M. $\text{pOH} = -\log(0.001) = 3$.

questions.question: What is the pH of a $0.1$ M solution of $KOH$?
For a diprotic strong acid like $H_2SO_4$, the concentration of $H_3O^+$ in a $0.05$ M solution (assuming full dissociation of both protons) would be:
questions.explanation: Each mole of $H_2SO_4$ releases two moles of protons. $0.05 \cdot 2 = 0.10$ M.

questions.question: Which of these metal hydroxides is considered a strong base?
questions.explanation: Group 1 and Group 2 metal hydroxides (like Calcium, Sodium, Potassium) are generally strong bases.

questions.question: If the pH of a strong acid solution is 1.0, what is the molarity of the acid?
Why do strong acids conduct electricity better than weak acids of the same concentration?
options: They produce a higher concentration of mobile ions
They contain more electrons per molecule
questions.explanation: Conductivity depends on the presence of ions. Because strong acids dissociate fully, they provide many more ions to carry the charge.

questions.question: A $1.0 \cdot 10^{-12}$ M solution of $HCl$ is extremely dilute. What would be the approximate pH of this solution?
questions.explanation: At extremely low concentrations, the autoionization of water ($10^{-7}$ M) dominates. Adding a tiny amount of acid won't make the water basic (pH 12), it will keep it very close to neutral.
